Projects About
Contribution on Incompact3D

Incompact3D is a sixth-order finite difference solver for Navier Stokes equation. The forces calculation subroutine was expanded for evaluation of Lift and Drag for 3D immersed bodies using Control Volume approach.

FortranHPCParallel ProgrammingCFD
FreeFEM-Euler

An incompressible inviscid flow solver was developed in FreeFEM++ with support for in-built and GMSH based meshes. The 3D solver is currently being developed for parallel computation.

FreeFEM++CFD
Comparison between NEk5000 and Xcompact3D

A numerical experiment was conducted for internal comparison to compare NEK5000 and Xcompact3d code in terms of performance and accuracy. The flow over cylinder at Re=40 was choosen as the benchmark case. Along with accuracy, the effect of domain size on the accuracy of simulation was tested.

NEK5000Xcompact3DDNSCFD
AutoPlotCV

A Python based program to automatically detect and digitize graphs using CV and Neural Networks. The code was developed as a course project for Computer Vision course.

PythonComputer VisionMachine Learning
UHF/VHF Standalone Antenna Mast Retraction Mechanism

A standalone antenna mast retarction mechanism was designed for the SSPACE Labs at IIST. The antenna is frequently (usually twice a week) lowered from its usual standing position for maintainance purposes. Lowering the antenna with bare hands is posing difficulty and risks antenna for damages. Thus, a mechanism was proposed to solve the following issues.

DynamicsMechanismsDesign and AnalysisCatiaSolidWorks
Thrust Vectoring Nozzles of Sukhoi Su-30 MKI

TThe mechanism of the Thrust Vectoring Nozzles of Sukhoi Su-30 MKI was studied under this project as mechanical report. A CAD model of the mechanism was also made in Fusion 360 and it was simulated to understand the mechanism in deep. The project was done as a course project for Basic Engineering Lab.

MechanismsAutodesk Fusion 360Engineering
Analysis of Globemaster C-17

The performance of C17 Globemaster was analyzed in this report. The various performance parameters was presented by the manufacturer and experimentally tested by operators were compared to the values we obtained from a theoretical analysis. The theoritically obtained values were in very close to the claimed values.

Military AviationMATLABPythonLaTeXAircraft Design
Advanced Generation Combat Aircraft - Laakshya

The first baby step towards Aircraft Designing, I took in 11th. This design maybe immature but it helped me to learn expressing my ideas and giving it a shape. It helped me to connect to brilliant scientists and aircraft designers at ADA (Aeronautical Development Agency) and IIT KGP.
